caption: This is a cast of Auguste Bartholdi's Lady Liberty statue in the Luxembourg Garden. It is one of several that you can see around Paris, the original being installed here in 1906.  What you see today is a replica (2012) and a smaller version of the famous Statue of Liberty in New York City. This is one of over a hundred monuments scattered around Luxembourg Garden and is well worth making time to find on the west side if interested in monument viewing during your travels.

Set in the gated Luxembourg Garden, this replica is a smaller stature but surrounding by green grass and has a beautiful large tree in its background. Most is the garden‚Äôs activity areas do not have grass. The garden does have hours and late November, the guards were blowing a whistle around 5 pm to tell people to leave.
It always fun, exploring the city looking for this icon statue, nice to spend a little time in this lovely gardens.
Small and yet very powerful.

This is just a bronze replica of the original statue (not the one in New York), but the one in front of Muse√® D'Orsay.  But isn't it nice to walk around the park, sit on a bench and admire such a nice statue, even if it's a replica.
One of the 4 Statue of Liberty in Paris. It is situated inside the Luxembourg garden
If you can't go to New York at least see the small one. Not the same but... Still beautiful. The park also is something else worth the visit. Specially in the morning having a coffee there.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê  This hidden gem is a smaller replica of the iconic New York statue, and it's perfectly nestled among the lush greenery and stunning surroundings of the park. It's an excellent spot for photo ops, and I loved learning about the history behind the statue.  If you're in Paris, make sure to take a stroll through the Luxembourg Gardens and visit this magnificent replica. A must-see for history buffs and those who appreciate the beauty of art and architecture. Highly recommended!

This place is a nice pitspot üöè on your next trip to Paris! üá´üá∑ Statue of Liberty üóΩ inside the Luxembourg üá±üá∫ Gardens üèûÔ∏è is an iconic historical landmark üèõÔ∏è and is smaller version of it's counterpart in NYC. üá∫üá≤ I wish there was more to do here!
Went for a stroll at Luxemburg Garden on 10/16/23, and had the chance to look at the statue from afar, as they were doing some landscaping work and the access to that section was closed.

Great place to visit but stay off the grass.  It was a fun adventure trying to locate the statue.  The building next to the park is the French Senate and the security is real so be carful when approaching a security guard.  The guards are very serous and do not care that your "just looking."

Cool little statue i found wondering through the parks of Paris. It highly recommend this park as it‚Äôs pretty extensive with lots of well maintained gardens and flower beds. Wasn‚Äôt expecting to find the Statue of Liberty here which was nice and had a good description in French - but thankfully had google translate.
Like the one in the USA but smaller :).  It is located in the beautiful Luxembourg garden, the area is green and so well taken care of. It can be a fast visit during a walk around the park.

There are many replicas of the Statue of Liberty around the world. This one in Luxembourg Gardens is at a very pleasant, quiet location. Lots of trees, lots of grass, great scenery. No need to go to a river and cross by boat. Just walk up and say bon jour.
Nice sight, needs a clean but it is the replica of the original model used to build the real ones. The real one has been stored away for preservation

It is said that there are more than a hundred statues of liberty in the world, and there are four only in Paris. This one is the 4th Statue of Liberty which I have ever seen after New York, Japan and √éle des cygnes Hope to see as many the Statue of Liberty as possible

This is just a bronze replica of the original statue (not the one in New York), but the one in front of Muse√® D'Orsay.  But isn't it nice to walk around the park, sit on a bench and admire such a nice statue, even if it's a replica.

The original gangster (OG) of Liberty! Standing Tall (or short, as it is much smaller than the one in New York) in Luxembourg Park! There isn‚Äôt a lot of fanfare to it, but it is still something to see and appreciate that Americans owe so much to France in terms of our spirit and lust for freedom and personal liberty üòäüëçüá´üá∑ ‚Ä¶
Such a cool little sculpture in the middle of the gardens. Loved reading the historical plaque and feeling a little bit of New York in the middle of Paris

On the occasion of the Exposition Universelle of 1900, Bartholdi crafted a smaller version of the Statue of Liberty, which he subsequently gave to the Mus√©e du Luxembourg. In 1905, the statue was placed outside the museum in the Jardin du Luxembourg, where it stood for over a century, until 2014. It currently stands within the entrance hall to the Mus√©e d'Orsay, and a newly constructed bronze replica stands in its place in the Jardin du Luxembourg.
Its history and elegance are definitely reasons for visiting the statue while walking in the Luxembourg gardens!

Big surprise to find New York's Statue of Liberty sister in a small scale in the park in Paris. it's just a small statue difficult to find, there are few signs only and few tourists: probably they know that Liberty has several twin sisters in the same city of Paris. Some are in public areas or museums, others in private areas and business buildings.
Interesting to see it this close!
Not the biggest one in Paris but still very beautiful. We gave the kids a game to find it inside the park, they had a ball!!
Beautiful and historic, set in an amazing park. Explore and enjoy it all.
It‚Äôs a bronze replica of the original one used to create a scale up model in NYC.
Nice photo op in the park
Fun to see a much smaller version that was used as a model to create the NYC version.

The Statue of Liberty is the famous place in New york. It was my dream when I was a child, to go there you have to take a boat, but before I recommend you  to buy tickets from the net.  There are nice places to take pictures and see the tallest building in your way.  I recommend you go there the morning to avoid  the exposed sun.
Like a mini version of the real thing. Lovely little outdoor free gym below it, too. Good views of the Eiffel Tower, too.
It‚Äôs a little bit smaller than New York‚Äôs but apparently it‚Äôs one of 8 in Paris, so was a must to see.
Cute, small version of the famous statue in New York. Nice to see the connection between the countries
Pretty cool, didn't realise that it was the original model. Don't know where it went thought after it got replaced!
It seems to be an exact replica..Worth visiting when in Luxembourg garden

Many people overlook the bottom of the statue of liberty. Look for a bronze plaque dedicated to the victims of the September 11th, 2001 NYC attack. Near the plaque, a young oak tree was planted (and is thriving) in remembrance. An older french woman pointed this out to me. Very heartfelt & touching.
It is amazing at night to see the Statue of Liberty, a small version and learn about its history
I love this garden..a nice spot to just chill

I didn't get a chance to go to the large version when I was in NYC, so this is the next best thing. It's small but quite lovely and it's in a nice, quiet part of the Jardin du Luxembourg, so great for photo ops.
